newsitem.title: UK: UNO makes offer for World of Leather.
newsitem.headline: UNO makes offer for World of Leather.

text.p: UNO Plc, the specialist retailer of upholstered furniture, said on Wednesday it had made a recommended offer for World of Leather Plc valuing the company at approximately 14.27 million stg.
World of Leather, one of the largest specialist leather upholstered furniture retailers in England and Wales, said it had recommended the offer.
The offer, on the basis of 0.43542 of a new UNO share for each World of Leather share, values each World of Leather share at 118 pence, the companies said in a joint statement.
This represents a premium of around 41.2 percent over the share price of 83.5 pence on Monday -- the day before World of Leather announced it was in talks over a possible offer.
The full cash alternative prices World of Leather at 108 pence per share.
The acquisition will help the enlarged group "compete more effectively in the UK upholstered furniture market," said Paul Rosenblatt, chairman and chief executive of UNO.

"We believe the offer from UNO is fair and reasonable and consequently we are recommending our shareholders to accept the offer," said Richard Taylor, joint managing director and finance director of World of Leather.

World of Leather also reported annual results showing pretax profits for the year to December 31 of 1.03 million stg, against a loss of 517,000 stg the previous year. It proposed a total dividend of 2.0 pence per share, up from 1.6 pence.
World of Leather shares were trading 18-1/2 pence higher at 110 pence at 0830 GMT.
